intro: Neoplatytaenia pamirica, commonly known as the Pamir leafy spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lobed leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh alpine environments, with a short growing season and drought-resistant features. Its foliage contains chemicals that can deter herbivores, contributing to its survival in competitive ecosystems. Neoplatytaenia pamirica plays a role in local biodiversity and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to extreme climates.
